p: In order to characterize the antimicrobial activity of the oils extracted from the two different mint species, we have carried out Kirby and Bauer assays [ 16]. The normalization of oils inhibition halo is shown in Figure 2: as we can see, the oils were active against the four bacterial strains used for the experiments and they were particularly active against the bacilli. Generally, essential oils from M. piperita showed a higher antimicrobial activity than the others, while in the case of the oils extracted from M. arvensis the effect of temperature was essential to increase their activity against the tested bacteria.
